intro: Annona stenophylla subsp. cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf soursop, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Annonaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces a large, spiny fruit that is typically harvested when fully mature. The fruit's interior contains a soft, white pulp with numerous black seeds, and it is often used in local cuisines and traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological and agricultural studies in its native habitats.
